meta.description: Turkish Airlines Lounge Washington D.C. at Washington Dulles International Airport (IAD), Concourse B. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Turkish Airlines Lounge Washington D.C.
lounge.description: Relax, refresh, and unwind in a spacious, luxurious oasis away from the bustling crowds. Enjoy serenity and calm in the Zen Corner, where you can read or meditate by a lush green wall, tranquil waterfall, and roaring fireplace. Savor the rich cuisine at one of two food buffets, and enjoy refreshing beverages from the drink stations or premium bar.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
You may book access through LoungeBuddy when flying with any carrier.
warning: All passengers departing from Washington Dulles can physically access this lounge - all concourses are connected by people movers. If you are not departing from Concourse B, please leave sufficient time to reach your gate.

reviews.content: Best food you can get from the lounges in IAD, not huge but surprisingly comfortable.
It was clean and quiet, the staff was very helpful and friendly.
Visoted in the morning - empty, but literally NO FOOD. Some muffins, little packed cheese, some very small packed tomatoes/cucumber. So pure comparing to their regular food, not worth a detour.
As always, nice and friendly staff, good food and drinks.
The lounge is clean and on a Monday at 9 AM it was not busy. Plenty of fresh fruits and hot food options along with assorted beverages. Plenty of seating and outlets. Good place to work.
Honoring Priority Pass and letting em all in is a pro and a con: while we appreciated access, it was so full we had to circle twice to find a place to sit. Good Mediterranean food and bar.
Virgin wasn’t accepting Priority Pass so headed here. This lounge is so much better!
Very small lounge with mirrors. Food offerings good early afternoon and they supply bottles of water unlike United Clubs.
I arrived at lounge @ 2:15 - they were closed to Priority Pass customers until 4:15- she said they were full. Makes no sense; they knew they would be full for next 2 hours??  No one would be leaving?
Very small lounge with above average food offerings and a manned bar hidden away from the main lounge area. I expected to be blown away since this is described as ‘luxe’. I was not.
Priority Pass restricted to after 4pm on Saturday.
This is one of the smallest, most crowded lounges. Quality of seating, food and service needs major improvement.
Very crowded at 4pm. Long line for bathrooms. Food limited, but reasonable quality. Not particularly clean.
Hour limited access for Priority Pass holders.
Accepted with PP at 8am, very few people inside. Not a wide spread of food, but what they had was quality. Will be back.
Busy but great lounge, food was quite impressive! Delicious spiced monkfish and chicken dishes, soups, salads. Was closed to PP members until 4:45pm.
Small and crowded. Does NOT accept Amex Bus Platinum card. Does accept Priority Pass card.
They had literally no one in the lounge and denied my husband and I access “in anticipation” of a rush of gold members. They had a sign that said closed to Priority Pass for the next 3+ hours. RUDE.
Was not allowed in at 3:30 pm, lounge seemed empty.
Yet another lounge that restricts access to specific hours for Priority Pass members. Makes it next to useless.
Best Priority lounge in IAD, must visit if you are at IAD.
Small but worth a visit. Better than most lounges.
Small and way overcrowded on last two trips on QR.  Couldn't try the food or find an empty seat. I'd give it a pass.
The food here is excellent, like being in a fine Turkish restaurant. Lounge is a bit small.
Hiked all the way across airport to go here at 3pm and Priority Pass not allowed in until 4:30. Did not look at all full.
Can’t say much about it. Looks comfortable but it was impossible to get a seat in the afternoon. Had an Espresso and visited LH Lounge that was almost empty.
Good lounge but a bit small and noisy when busy. Food, staff, drinks and amenities are excellent and couldn’t ask for more. Easy access from most terminal!
Got here at 920am. Very cramped in main area. Bar area was closed. The food was bare and not that great. Seating not that comfortable.
Here at 14:30. The Middle Eastern food is still very good. Crowded in the front room. Less so at the bar.
Got in with Priority Pass around 13:30. Food is really yummy, lounge is pretty and has good views of the tarmac.
Rejecting anyone with Priority Pass at 520pm.
Nice space for comfort food after a flight. Small space but OK if you can find a seat.
It's only fault is that it's good enough to be very busy.
Comfortable enough. No where as nice as the one in Istanbul. But good enough. Hot tasty food selections. Lines for the 2 restrooms. Bar is on the other side of the restrooms.
Seems to be under-staffed. Dirty dishes everywhere, food and trash on the floor, no bar staff on duty but the bar had a good selection.
Small and gets crowded quickly, fantastic food options though with restaurant-quality food.
Nice and quiet. Good food options and drinks for free. Seemed a bit understaffed. Tables still had piles of food and trash from previous people. Bathroom was out of toilet paper. Otherwise great.
Was able access with domestic first class United ticket. Excellent food and service. A little crowded at 2pm, but still managed to find a seat at the bar.

Out of my way to come here since I’m departing gate C11. Not too impressed. AMEX Centurion is much better. Not sure how this got a LUXE rating. Drink limit, food OK, very crowded. Seats uncomfortable.
Can’t rate. 2nd time denied entry with PP Select.
Very nice, upscale lounge.  superior to the IAD United lounges. Wasn’t consistently anyone working the bar & the lounge gets very busy late afternoon - bathroom lines long & seating gets scarce.
Denied access at 2:45pm with Priority Pass. Said it’s full but others allowed in. Said come back at 4:15pm.
Visited this lounge at 1300 on a Thursday with a guest using PP. As others said, it was busy. Great food and facilities, but not a great spot if you need to work.
Priority Pass has restrictions on when you can enter. Not very convenient.
Lounge was great! Went in around midday and lounge was rather empty, then quickly got very busy and very crowded. Food was great and they have even have a PlayStation you can use.
Not very big and incredibly overcrowded.
I’ve visited this lounge twice. 1st time- ok; 2nd time- excellent! 2nd time was on Mother’s Day and the offerings were great (salmon and grilled chicken). Just what I needed before a 10 hr flight.
Best lounge at IAD (including United First).
Went to lounge for early morning flight. Used PP to use lounge - pretty empty - plenty of seating available. Modern and updated decor with comfy seating, friendly staff, few food selections early.
Fairly tight spaced lounge...but the food...excellent!
Been here before, and it’s definitely nice. Was tied away at 3:00pm and it was pretty vacant...
Food was really good.  The Turkish lamb...yum.  Hummus. All so good.  Only ding is toilet paper was out in bathroom and the bar was unmanned (had to ask). Nice small lounge!
Turned away until after 1600hrs with Priority P. Looked crowded but OK inside.
So overcrowded I immediately left. No where to sit and completely overrun. More peace and quiet out at the gates.
Thursday 605 AM no issue getting in with PP. Food was pretty scarce but plenty of seating room. I didn’t stay long due to departure time.
Excellent food!!! Full entrees worth of delicious food with a nice separate room with large bar with bartender. Though the lounge is not small it was still crowded when I was there.
Denied access with Priority Pass. No access until after 16:30.
One of the best lounges on the East Coast (if not, the best). Great hot food options and wonderful service! Showers are a plus, too!
Very nice, very small. Better than Lufthansa and United lounges at the airport so worth making the trip to B concourse.

Great lounge for a 4 hr layover. Breakfast was nothing special, but lunch was quite tasty. Single shower that does the job after a long flight; an overall great place to relax before or between flights.
One of my favorite domestic lounges. Good food, good drinks, great service and if your Priority Pass won't get you in, United status will.
Great lounge with a nice set of eating options for breakfast. Quiet with friendly service. No issues getting in with Priority Pass and 2 guests.
Good amount of choices of food and snacks. Some of the chairs need some heavy duty steam cleaning thought. Great view of the tarmac for plane viewing.
Love this lounge.  Grilled chicken, meatballs, hummus, eggplant dip, potato leek soup, chocolate mousse and quite possibly the best baklava I’ve ever had...in an airport lounge no less!
Couldn’t access....due to too many people....seems to be a common theme lately.
Beautiful lounge - probably one of the best in USA - but on my visit I stood around at the bar for five minutes waiting to order a drink but couldn’t get service! The food selection was bare at 6pm.
Excellent food selection and friendly staff.
Gorgeous lounge; no issues with P Pass. Fairly empty this visit, yet hot/cold food remains lacking, dishes all over the place, and breads not refreshed. Not expected after reading reviews.
Been here four times and everytime they've turned away Priority Pass members.
The service is excellent, the area quiet, and the food is quality. This is well worth the price of straight-up buying admittance!
Delicious food, lovely wine, phenomenal Zen area. Staff could be nicer, but... overall recommended.
Got in late one evening as a United 1K traveling in and out of terminal A.  This is the closest lounge that accepts United Club access. It’s got a nice homey atmosphere and good food. Well done!
It's great when you can get in. I've been turned away twice with Priority Pass even when access is being sold. The food and service, however, is fantastic and among the best lounges in the US.
Priority Pass holders have lower priority than business fliers and other high status fliers, which is understandable. The lounge is not very big, but with great food and staff.
Was not accepting Priority Pass who weren't flying Star Alliance and business class. Gotta keep the riff raff out.

I can't rate what it's like inside as I was told it was full; Priority Pass and similar cards can't enter till it empties!
OK finally got in. Very friendly staff! :)
Sunny lounge with plentiful, fresh, delicious hot and cold food options (incl. many vegetarian options), kind staff, clean surroundings and sleek decor. A bit small, but cozy. Will definitely return!
A small lounge without much seating. Food is not bad, but nothing special.
Beautiful lounge, omnipresent staff provide quick refresh of food. Open late because of the 11 pm IAD-IST flight. Love the interior design. Wish it had more bathrooms.
They arbitrarily decided they were not letting in Priority Pass customers. Said I should come back later - of course later I was on the airplane. The lounge was NOT full. Terrible.
One of the better lounges in North America. A bit small but overflow seating in a separate bar area.  Good food selection. Big windows great to fight jet lag while waiting for next flight.
Great food. A little small, but very nice and quiet.
Helpful staff, quality food! We came over a terminal just to check it out, definitely worth it.
The lounge is a bit small but the food and service is great. The United Club food is like eating at a 7/11 compared to here.
Great place to sit back and relax. Staff is very friendly and food is delicious. Spent a few hours here on a Saturday afternoon. Although my flight was departing from C concourse, this was worth it!
The lounge is next to B43 and is a decent place to spend a few hours. The menu was not extensive but good and all regular drinks as well. The decor is nice as well just similar to any Turkish Lounge.
Screaming kids and nowhere to sit. Only one men's room. Awful.
Great drink selection.  Very nice food selection, especially for a lounge in the states. Only downside: restrooms are single occupants, and only one men's and one women's, long lines :(
Screaming kids and sitting shoulder to shoulder. It's okay if you're a Priority Pass member but this is too crowded for business class passengers. Hop over to Lufthansa lounge it's empty and quiet.
Wow, a lounge of this caliber in the States. The food is about as good as a Centurion. Rather small and crowded on a Friday afternoon. But well worth the visit.
They're out of crackers, how do you run out of crackers? Also most liquor bottles are empty. It feels like rundown lounge, one outlet between 4 people. Over crowded and no place to sit.
Easily the best PP lounge at IAD. It might even be one of the best Priority Pass lounges available in North America. Excellent food when I was there around dinner and solid service.
Great lounge at IAD. Small bathrooms so long queues form. Middle Eastern food is delicious. Better than any other Priority Pass elgible lounges at IAD.
Great selection of food. IMHO, better than the IAD LH Senator lounge.

The lounge is not very big, which gives it an intimate feel. Breakfast buffet was nice with eggs, cheeses, yogurt, fruits, veggies, and of course great coffee. Business area with printer and computers.
Great lounge. Nice people. Tasty food.
Excellent lounge! One of the better Priority Pass lounges. Bar is around the corner, and they have extra seating there. Staff are courteous and professional. Try the Baklava, and Turkish delights.
Breakfast of fruits, assorted breads, yogurt, miso soup. Great espresso machines. The layout is deceptive, there is a bar and lounge area if you follow the window and an upstairs area also.
A nice reprieve from the average lounge at Dulles. Warm food. Good expresso. Baklava. Did I mention the baklava?

Really nice lounge. Bar around the corner so you must go look for it. Service is great, maybe too good! Took my food before I'm done. Could have better warm food but a very good lounge. Saudi airline.

location.terminalDirections: After security, near the Air France boarding area, close to Gate 22.

otherLounges.name: Etihad Airways Lounge (Chase Sapphire Lounge by The Club)

location.terminalDirections: Located between Concourses A and B, in front of Gate A32 and the main Duty Free Store.
Concourse B, at the top of the escalators after arriving from AeroTrain

otherLounges.name: British Airways The Concorde Dining Room

location.terminalDirections: Near the Lufthansa Departure Gates B49-B51.
Near the Lufthansa Departure Gates B49-B51.
After Security, take the shuttle bus or train to Concourse C. Location is near Gate C14.
On the Arrivals (Baggage Claim) Level, across from Baggage Claim #11 and #12.
Located just past the main security checkpoint.
